WFRP4E.system.title: Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay 4a Edizione
WFRP4E.system.description: Un sistema completo per giocare a 'Un tetro mondo di perigliose avventure' di Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay nella piattaforma Foundry VTT.
ITEM.Import:
Sei sicuro di voler importare il risultato della tua domanda?
({number} elementi)
SETTINGS.InitHint: Configurare quale metodo è usato per determinare chi muove prima in combattimento.
SETTINGS.InitDefault: Default (Dalla più alta alla più bassa Iniziativa, in caso di pareggio Agilità)
SETTINGS.InitSL: Tira un test di Iniziativa, l'LS più alto inizia prima
SETTINGS.InitD10: Tira un d10 e aggiungi l'Iniziativa, il valore più alto inizia prima
SETTINGS.InitD10Agi: Tira un d10, aggiungi i Bonus Iniziativa e Agilità, il valore più alto inizia prima
SETTINGS.CapAdvIB: Imposta il valore massimo di Vantaggio come Bonus Iniziativa
SETTINGS.CapAdvIBHint: Imposta il valore massimo di Vantaggio come Bonus Iniziativa del personaggio.
SETTINGS.FastSLHint: Determinare LS con la regola opzionale: LS Rapido come descritto a pag.152.
SETTINGS.TestsAbove100Hint: Usa la regola opzionale: Prove oltre 100% come descritto a pag.151. In caso di successo si ottiene +1 LS per ogni 10 pieno oltre 100%.
SETTINGS.CriticalsFumblesAllTests: Critici e Disastri su tutti i Test
SETTINGS.CriticalsFumblesAllTestsHint: Lanciare un doppio su qualsiasi test si traduce in un successo/fallimento eccezionale.
SETTINGS.ExtendedTestsHint: Ottenere +0 o -0 LS in una Prova Prolungata non modifica il totale. Durante una Prova Prolungata ogni successo aggiunge un minimo di +1 LS e un fallimento -1 LS (pag.155).
SETTINGS.ChannelingNegativeSLHint: Tirare un LS negativo sulla canalizzazione si traduce in un +0, assicurando che non venga preso alcun progresso dal tentativo di canalizzazione.
SETTINGS.TestDialogAutoPopulate: Finestra di Dialogo Test con informazioni auto impostate
SETTINGS.TestDialogAutoPopulateHint: Questa impostazione inserisce automaticamente le informazioni nella finestra di Dialogo Test. Alcuni esempi includono: se si è in possesso di armi difensive  si riempiono automaticamente 'Bonus LS' nelle finestre di dialogo dei tiri per le armi da mischia. Ciò si verifica solo se non è il turno del personaggio. Anche quando brandisci un'Arma Accurata o Imprecisa (al turno del personaggio).
SETTINGS.TestDialogDefaultDifficulty: Difficoltà predefinita del test al di fuori del combattimento
SETTINGS.TestDialogDefaultDifficultyHint: Imposta la difficoltà Test predefinita su Media se non c'è combattimento. Al di fuori del combattimento, o se non selezionata, la difficoltà predefinita è Impegnativa. In ogni caso, questo può essere ignorato nella finestra di dialogo.
SETTINGS.NpcAverageChar: Imposta le caratteristiche medie dei PNG
SETTINGS.NpcAverageCharHint: L'immissione di un valore di specie riconosciuto per un PNG imposta automaticamente le loro caratteristiche sul valore medio per la specie.
SETTINGS.PartialChannellingHint: Una regola comune che migliora la flessibilità della Canalizzazione. Invece di richiedere all'LS di raggiungere il VL dell'incantesimo, puoi invece lanciare in qualsiasi momento con il VL ridotto dell'LS guadagnato finora.
SETTINGS.RoundSummaryHint: Quando un round finisce, mostra tutti i combattenti con le loro Condizioni.
SETTINGS.StatusTurnStart: Mostra lo stato dei combattenti ad inizio turno
SETTINGS.StatusTurnStartHint: Quando un Combattente inizia il suo turno, viene mostrato il suo stato (Condizioni e Modificatori). Questo messaggio di stato è identico a quello mostrato facendo clic con il tasto destro del mouse sul combattente.
SETTINGS.FocusTurnStart: Quando un round finisce, mostra tutti i combattenti con le loro Condizioni.
SETTINGS.FocusTurnStartHint: Quando un round finisce, mostra tutti i combattenti con le loro Condizioni.
SETTINGS.HideTestDataHint: Le schede nella chat dei test del GM non mostrano ai giocatori dati PNG sensibili.
SETTINGS.ManualChatCardsHint: Mostra il risultato del tiro vuoto da compilare se si usano dadi fisici.
SETTINGS.PlayerBrowserHint: Consenti ai giocatori di accedere al browser degli oggetti.
SETTINGS.AdvantageBonusHint: Configura il bonus che il vantaggio offre.
SETTINGS.DangerousCritsHint: Se un personaggio viene ridotto a meno di 0 ferite, se il numero di ferite negative è maggiore del BR del personaggio, si subisce una Ferita Critica.
SETTINGS.DangerousCritsModHint: L'importo per cui modificare il Colpo Critico.
SETTINGS.WeaponLengthHint: Usa la lunghezza dell'arma per applicare i modificatori come descritto dalla regola a pagina 297.
SETTINGS.SoundEffectsHint: Aggiungi effetti sonori al contesto delle varie azioni.
SETTINGS.CustomCursorHint: Usa un cursore di Warhammer stilizzato (aggiorna per applicare).
SETTINGS.AutoFillAdvHint: Riempi automaticamente la casella 'modificatore' nella finestra di dialogo di lancio con il bonus dato dal Vantaggio. Disabilitalo se la regola del Vantaggio viene utilizzata in modo diverso.
SETTINGS.LimitEquippedWeaponsHint: Limita il numero di armi equipaggiate: consenti di equipaggiare solo 1 arma a due mani o 2 armi a una mano.
SETTINGS.ThrowMoneyHint: (Richiede Dice So Nice) Lancia monete quando viene utilizzato il sistema di pagamento/credito.
SETTINGS.RangeAutoCalculation: Calcolo Automatico del Modificatore di Intervallo
SETTINGS.RangeAutoCalculationHint: Precompila la finestra di dialogo del lancio con un modificatore basato sulla distanza tra i token.
SETTINGS.PlayerExperienceEditingHint: Allows players to manually edit their experience point values.
SETTINGS.UnofficialGrimoireHint: Regole ispirate ad un Grimorio non ufficiale, per i dettagli si prega di controllare su Wiki: qui
SETTINGS.UseGroupAdvantageHint: Raggruppa il vantaggio del giocatore e del nemico insieme (come descritto in Up in Arms). Per associare un attore al gruppo 'Giocatori', l'attore deve essere di proprietà di un giocatore o avere una disposizione token 'Amichevole', altrimenti deve essere nel gruppo 'Nemico'.
SETTINGS.MooHint:
Assorted mechanics change that I believe have potential to improve the game. Note that the ones listed here are not an exhaustive list of the house rules I use, but only those that can be applied in code.

For the entire list, please see the Wiki Page.
Note that these rules are generally all meant to be used together.
Feedback is always appreciated. Please use the Github Discussion Board for discussion of the mechanics.
SETTINGS.MooAdvantageHint: Instead of +10 per Advantage, you gain +1 SL per Advantage on successful tests
SETTINGS.MooConditionTriggersHint: Conditions activate at the end of the character's turn, instead of the end of the round.
SETTINGS.MooCritMOdifiersHint:
When you take Damage past 0 Wounds, Add or Subtract 10 from the Critical Hit Table for every point of Damage difference from your Toughness Bonus.

Ex. I have 4 Wounds left, 50 Toughness. I take 12 Damage. That would go 8 past 0. With a TB of 5, that would result in a +30 to the rolled critical.

Ex. I have 4 Wounds left, 50 Toughness, I take 5 Damage. That would go 1 past 0. With a TB of 5, that would result in a -40 to the rolled critical.
SETTINGS.MooSLDamageHint: Opposed Damage calculation is based only on the attacker's SL, instead of the difference between attacker and defender
SETTINGS.MooRangedDamageHint: Damage from ranged weapons is now subtracted by the tens digit of any modifier in a test. +20 = -2 Damage, -30 = +3 Damage
SETTINGS.MooMagicAdvantageHint: Advantage Applies to Channelling and not Casting. You still gain advantage from casting.
SETTINGS.MooOvercastingHint: Overcasting 'spends' the SL used, so if the spell does damage, for each Overcast used, the spell does –2 Damage, and is easier to oppose
SETTINGS.MooCatastrophicMiscastsHint: Adds the Catastrophic Miscasts table and alters the existing tables. Additionally, Rolling 100 on a Cast or Channelling test increases your miscast level by 1
SETTINGS.MooCriticalChannellingHint: If you successfully cast a spell from a Critical Channell, you add +SL equal to the spell's CN. These SL cannot be used to Overcast, only the SL generated in the test. If you fail the Casting Test, you miscast, or increase your miscast by 1.
SETTINGS.MooCastAfterChannellingHint: When casting a channelled spell, a failed casting counts as an interruption. You can keep the SLs channeled if this test is passed.
SETTINGS.MooPenetratingHint: Give the option for Penetrating to have a value associated with it, Penetrating X - where the weapon ignores X AP (if none specified, defaults to Penetrating 2)
SETTINGS.MooShieldAPHint: Shield AP and Critical Mitigation (see below) is only applied if you succeed your defensive test.
SETTINGS.MooCriticalMitigationHint: (Instead of Deflection) Upon suffering a Critical Hit, for each AP in the location, the Critical Wound roll is reduced by 10. If the resulting roll is negative, no Critical Wound is received. After the Critical Wound is resolved, the outermost layer of armor is damaged, its AP reduced by 1. This only applies if the attacker targets.
SETTINGS.MooRangeBandsHint: Range Weapons have an Optimal range, corresponding to a range band. Targeting a creature not within this range receives penalties based on how many steps away. See the wiki above for more details.
SETTINGS.MooSizeDamageHint: Damage bonuses are based on absolute size, instead of relative size (see wiki page linked above)
SETTINGS.MooHomebrewItemHint: Changes (including application of above rules) various items. See the wiki page linked above. **Warning: Recommended only with a new game and most above rules included**
SETTINGS.useWoMOvercast: Use Winds of Magic Overcast Rules
SETTINGS.useWoMOvercastHint: Use the overcasting mechanics provided in the Winds of Magic supplement, described on page 23.
MOO.Prone: Moo's House Rule: You are considered one range band farther away when determining ranged attacks.
MOO.Broken:
You are terrified, defeated, panicked, or otherwise convinced you are going to die. On your turn, your Move and Action must be used to run away as fast as possible until you are in a good hiding place beyond the sight of any enemy; then you can use your Action on a Skill that allows you to hide more effectively. You also receive a penalty of –10 to all Tests not involving running and hiding.

You cannot Test to rally from being Broken if you are Engaged with an enemy. If you are unengaged, at the end of each Round, you may attempt a Cool Test to remove a Broken Condition, with each SL removing an extra Broken Condition, and the Difficulty determined by the circumstances you currently find yourself: it is much easier to rally when hiding behind a barrel down an alleyway far from danger (Average +20) than it is when three steps from a slavering Daemon screaming for your blood (Very Hard –30).

If you spend a full Round in hiding out of line-of-sight of any enemy, you remove 1 Broken Condition.

Once all Broken Conditions are removed, gain 1 Fatigued Condition.
MOO.Bleeding:
You are bleeding badly. Lose 1 Wound at the end of every Round, ignoring all modifiers. Further, suffer a penalty of –10 to any Tests to resist Festering Wounds, Minor Infection, or Blood Rot. If you reach 0 Wounds, immediately make the Endurance Test to stay standing (with a -10 penalty for each Bleeding Condition), otherwise you fall @Condition[Unconscious], and you must remake this test every time you take damage from Bleeding. If you are at 0 Wounds, regardless of if you are unconscious or not, at the end of Round, you have a 10% chance of dying per Bleeding Condition you have; so, if you had 3 Bleeding Conditions, you would die from blood loss on a roll of 0–30. If a double is scored on this roll, your wound clots a little: lose 1 Bleeding. You cannot regain consciousness until all Bleeding Conditions are removed (see Injury)

A Bleeding Condition can be removed with: a successful Heal Test, with each SL removing an extra Bleeding Condition; or with any spell or prayer that heals Wounds, with one Condition removed per Wound healed.

Once all Bleeding Conditions are removed, gain one @Condition[Fatigued] Condition.
MOO.Penetrating: The weapon is highly effective at penetrating armor. It ignores (Rating) AP.
MOO.Simple: Simple weapons can be used with Melee (Basic) with no penalty.
MOO.Momentum: These weapons are hefty and require momentum to bring fully to bear. They gain the specified properties when the wielder has Advantage.
MOO.Items: Homebrew item changes have been applied to the compendium. See console for details.
MOO.FailedCast: Failure to Cast while Channelling counts as an interruption.

DIALOG.ShowTableHint: Mostra la tabella ai giocatori nella barra laterale e nel menu /tavolo
DIALOG.UseIngredientTooltip:
You may focus your magic through an appropriate material component before discharging your spell. Ingredients react differently depending on how you funnel your magic through them. Before you cast or channel, you must choose whether to use the ingredient for Power or Control. Ingredients are consumed even when the spell fails.
Power Ingredient: When used during a Channelling Test, a power ingredient doubles the number of SL aquired on success (see overchannelling). When used during a Casting Test, a power ingredient allows you to reverse the dice and choose the result for your Casting Test. However, if the units die after reverse of your Casting Test exceeds your Willpower Bonus, the energy exceeds your grasp and you unleash a Minor Miscast.
Control Ingredient: When used during a Channelling or Casting Test, a control ingredient acts as a target for out-of-control magic. Reduce the severity of one suffered Miscast by one table: ie, from Catastrophic to Major, Major to Minor, or Minor to none.
DIALOG.OverchannellingTooltip: When you are Channelling, you are presumed to vent any excess SL beyond that which would reduce the spell’s CN to 0 harmlessly. After the Test is rolled, you may choose instead to keep the excess magical energy that you have gathered and apply it to Overcasting once the spell is cast. (Example: Bianca channels a spell with a CN of 3 and scores 7 SL; she chooses to bank the extra 4 SL for Overcasting effects once the spell is cast.) But this extra power is not without its cost. If the casting Test fails, you lose all channelled energy and suffer a Minor Miscast. Further, you count any double or any roll ending in a 0 over your channelling or Language (Magick) Skill as a Fumble (so, 00, 99, 90, 88, etc) and any Critical or Fumble on these Tests is a Major Miscast instead.
DIALOG.QuickcastingTooltip: If you forfeit your Move and all Free Actions, you may use your Turn to quickly Channel and Cast in the same Action. Because you are rushing, increase the severity of any suffered Miscast by one table (ie, from Minor to Major or Major to Catastrophic).

CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Tables.Title: Tabelle
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Tables.Usage.Note: /table <anything-unrecognized> aprirà il menu della guida della tabella
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Conditions.Title: Condizioni
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Conditions.Usage.N: corrisponderà alla condizione di ortografia più vicina e la visualizzerà (es. / cond abl == / cond ablaze)
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Properties.Title: Item Properties
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Properties.Usage.N: will match the closest spelling condition and display it (eg. /prop acc == /prop accurate)
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.NameGeneration.Usa: Genera un nome in chat (accessibile anche facendo clic sull'etichetta <Nome> su un PNG o una scheda creatura)
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.AvailabilityTest.U: esegue un test di disponibilità per determinare la disponibilità e lo stock di un articolo.
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Pay.Title: pagare
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Pay.Usage.Note: Se questo comando viene inviato dal GM, creerà invece una chat card in cui ai giocatori viene offerto di pagare per l'importo inserito dal GM.
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Credit.Title: Credito
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Credit.Usage.Note:
This command is GM only. An amount of money entered by the GM will be sent to actors/players, with the following options:
  • /credit amount split (default): Display as chat card for all users, with a button for them to receive payment. Example: /credit 12gc2bp
  • /credit amount player_name: Display a chat card for the designated player only.
  • /credit amount actor_name : Automatically adds money to the designated actor. Only a part of the actor name can be used, so if the actor's name is Kastor Lieberung, then you can write /credit 12ss kastor.
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Corruption.Title: Corruption
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Corruption.Usage.N: Use this to prompt your players to roll against corrupting influences.
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Exp.Title: Experience
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Exp.Usage.Note: Use this to reward exp to your players. Their exp log will automatically be filled out with the reason given.
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Travel.Title: Travel
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Travel.Usage.Note: Based off of the Travel Distances in the Empire PDF.
CHAT.CommandLine.Help.Link: Consulta il Wiki per ulteriori informazioni sulle funzionalità di questo sistema

TRAVEL.TravelMessageRoad:
Road : {road_distance} miles
  By Coach : {road_days} days, danger is {road_danger_string}
  By Heavy Horse : {road_horse_heavy_days} days, danger is {road_danger_string}
  By Fast Horse : {road_horse_fast_days} days, danger is {road_danger_string}
  On Foot : {road_feet_days} days, danger is {road_danger_feet_string}
TRAVEL.Helper:
The distances are based on the document Travel Distances in the Empire, by Jackdays. The distances has been reviewed according to medieval historical documents about travelling. The direction of rivers flow has been also taken into account.
Usage : /travel town or /travel town1 town2 or /travel
